answers.author: Stephanie Klinkenberger
answers.text:
Virginia Beach Parks and Recreation Foundation
The Virginia Beach Parks and Recreation Foundation is the non-profit partner of the Department of Parks and Recreation. The Foundation was formed in 2004 to secure, manage and invest privately raised funds, gifts and bequests in support of the Department’s programs, services and facilities. The Foundation is a 501(c)(3) charitable organization created by a group of dedicated citizens.
Please visit the Foundation website at www.vbprf.org for more information, how to become involved or to read about their accomplishments. If you have a program or project that you would like the Foundation to consider, please contact the Foundation at:
Mailing Address:
Virginia Beach Parks and Recreation Foundation
Post Office Box 2237
Virginia Beach, VA 23450
Email:
vbprf@yahoo.com
You should be able to find good information on Virginia Beach's Parks & Recreation Foundation on their website.
Good luck!

author: Jennifer Chadwell
text:
The City of Arlington's Parks and Recreation Department is looking into the formation of a "Friends of the Parks" group.  We are curious what challenges (if any) other cities faced in such a formation and how you started the process, steps that were taken, guidelines that were drafted.
Any information would help at this point.
title: Friends of Parks Group
